citations.narrative:
In reviewing records, it was found that tag #72 had been used on a breeding dog that was transferred to another facility
on 1/8/2024 and then was re-used on another recently acquired dog. Using the same tag number to identify more than
one animal can make animal husbandry records confusing and difficult to know which animal the number refers to. No tag
number shall be used to identify more than one animal. No number shall be repeated within a 5-year period.
***Correct by 1/11/2024.

Per the licensee, the last time physical exams for each adult dog done by the Attending Veterinarina (AV) was January
11, 2023 (a year ago). The AV confirmed today on the phone that in December 2023 the licensee had health certificate
physical exams done for seven adult dogs, however physical exams for each adult dog in the kennel weren't done. A
complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian at least every 12 months is
required for each dog on hand to ensure that each dog is healthy. Ensure that the physical exams for each dog on hand
are completed at least once every 12 months.
***Correct by March 8, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.53 
   
Use of tags. 
In reviewing records, it was found that tag #72 had been used on a breeding dog that was transferred to another facility 
on 1/8/2024 and then was re-used on another recently acquired dog. Using the same tag number to identify more than 
one animal can make animal husbandry records confusing and difficult to know which animal the number refers to. No tag 
number shall be used to identify more than one animal. No number shall be repeated within a 5-year period.  
***Correct by 1/11/2024. 
3.13(a)(2) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Per the licensee, the last time physical exams for each adult dog done by the Attending Veterinarina (AV) was January 
11, 2023 (a year ago). The AV confirmed today on the phone that in December 2023 the licensee had health certificate 
physical exams done for seven adult dogs, however physical exams for each adult dog in the kennel weren't done. A 
complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog by the attending veterinarian at least every 12 months is 
required for each dog on hand to ensure that each dog is healthy. Ensure that the physical exams for each dog on hand 
are completed at least once every 12 months.  
***Correct by March 8, 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
